measure.CatchLine: Extends the permissible uses of net revenue from a new or increased local transient lodging tax to include public safety services and certain costs related to "community infrastructure.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Digest: The Act would let a city or county use net revenue from its hotel tax to fund the costs of public safety and costs that are tied to infrastructure. (Flesch Readability Score: 60.7). 
	Extends the permissible uses of net revenue from a new or increased local transient lodging tax to include public safety services and certain costs related to "community infrastructure." 
	Takes effect on the 91st day following adjournment sine die.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to the use of local transient tax revenue; amending ORS 320.300, 320.305, 320.350 and 320.360; and prescribing an effective date.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to the use of local transient tax revenue; prescribing an effective date.

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Referred to Emergency Management, General Government, and Veterans with subsequent referral to Revenue.
